column4: if I have my router... and then put a hub behind it, on one of the lan ports...can I then plug other PC's into that hub.. and have them all network each other AND also have web/WAN access too?
yes if your router provides DHCP which most all do.
it might not be receiving any info from your video card or monitor or both
because your hardware may not be talking back to the quiries from the software.. I'll send you a link from ubottu that might help.
thanks. I guess there's no easy way.. it's a hack job.. right? Is there anything that will probe and discover the values I need to work into my xorg.conf?
what kind of video card do you have/
it's on the mobo.. via rhine.. with chrome 9 ..
hang on a sec.
I appreciate your help!

there are threads out there that talk about chrome 9 being difficult if not impossible.. there are two drivers listed in synaptic.  if only one is loaded you might try the other. check System>Admin>hardware drivers to see if you need to "enable" a driver there. there is a driver for chrome 9 in .rpm format. you might have to google for one in .deb format.  sorry beyond that I'm stumped..
thanks for the pointers..
typing xrandr in terminal will give you a list of "supported" resolutions.. randr controls video for the most part and is very flexable.. you can use it to list a new resolution and activate it.
then with the live cd check xorg and see what's listed for the driver.
with compiz running or in normal mode.
just normal mode.. I have to upgrade my video adapter before I can run compiz

to add more desktops then point at them and right mouse click, properties.. you'll see where to increase/decrease.  the mouse wheel will sometimes switch between desktops but also ctrl+alt+right or left arrow
thank  you
np. :)
hi again. hoping to get drivers installed for my system, I just switched monitors. and can't get anything higher than 800x600
ati or nvidia?
these are VIA Technologies..
via is beyond my experience.. chrome can be a pain in the ...... best to www.google.com/linux and search chrome 9 ubuntu
